alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Marion; Muscogee; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 6:23PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Marion, southeastern Muscogee, eastern Chattahoochee and southwestern Taylor Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 623 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Jamestown/south Fort Benning to near Eelbeck/West Fort Benning to Marion Estates, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Butler, Cusseta, Brantley, Christopher, Marion Estates, Eelbeck/West Fort Benning, Charing, Oakland, Mauk, Tazewell and Juniper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for west central Georgia.
